msContents.summary: Treatise on surgery. Parts of the second chapter and all of the third chapter of the 3-chapter treatise, which is the last of the 30 treatises in the Taṣrīf li-man ʻajiza ʻan al-taʼlīf, a larger work by al-Zahrawi. Topics in the manuscript include incision, perforation, blood-letting, wounds, bone-setting, dislocations, and sprains. Contemporary corrections in margins; additional notes in a Maghrebi hand also in margins.

msItem.title: Maqālah fī al-ʻamal bi-al-yad
msItem.author: Abū al-Qāsim Khalaf ibn ʻAbbās al-Zahrāwī, d. 1013?

supportDesc.extent: 108 leaves : 177 x 125 (135 x 90) mm. bound to 177 x 140 mm

collation.p: Paper, 108; 1¹² 2⁸ 3¹² 4⁴ 5⁸ 6¹² 7⁸ 8¹² 9⁸ 10-11¹²; [1-85, i, 86-107]; modern foliation in pencil, upper center recto. Catchword on each leaf, lower left verso.

decoDesc.decoNote: Numerous illustrations of surgical instruments in black or black and red ink; headings in red.
Illustration, Surgical instrument, f. i verso

binding.p: Later morocco binding, blind-stamped, with flap.

origin.p: Written in Mesopotamia (now mostly Iraq) in A.H. 869 (1464).

history.provenance: Sold at auction at Sotheby's, 2 Apr. 2002, lot 23, to Lawrence J. Schoenberg.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.

keywords.term: Surgical instruments and apparatus--Early works to 1800
